Key Match Events: Florian Wirtz scored an equalizer in the 89th minute
Mikel Merino scored the winning goal in the 119th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Some will now consider Spain the favourites to win Euro 2024 after beating the hosts in dramatic fashion
Germany’s physical approach continued, with Taylor flashing his first yellow card at Antonio Rudiger for a wild lunge to stop Olmo just outside the hosts’ box
Post-Match Reflections: Spain had never previously beaten a host nation in a knockout tie at either a World Cup or European Championship
Germany will be stung, but not too disheartened by this result
De la Fuente’s substitutions had invited the swing in momentum in the game
Toni Kroos was keen to ensure that Germany’s summer tournament was solely about the team and not his farewell tour
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game settled down somewhat after the initial physicality
Germany’s physical approach continued, with Taylor flashing his first yellow card at Antonio Rudiger for a wild lunge to stop Olmo just outside the hosts’ box
Spain had never previously beaten a host nation in a knockout tie at either a World Cup or European Championship
